page.title: 01Downs North East of Slindon
page.content: The land rises gently form south to north. The A29 Bognor to London road passes south of Slindon and travels north east using steep sided Fairmile Bottom. South of the A29 are mixed woods with two picnic areas and a nature trail. North of it is open farmland with scattered woods on north - south spurs and valleys. Crops are potatoes and grain. Slindon village is compact and mostly owned by the National Trust. Visitors are attracted by pond, forge, lock up, thatched post office, an annual pumpkin display and by small flint cottages which outnumber larger brick houses. Walkers enjoy long views from the footpaths across farmland northwards towards the South Downs Way.
